alternative_parents.description: Polyaromatic hydrocarbon derivatives containing a tetracyclic cycle made up of four linearly fused benzene rings, one of which bears two ketone groups at position 1 and 4.
alternative_parents.name: Tetracenequinones

alternative_parents.description: Molecules or a portion of a molecule composed of amino-modified sugars.
alternative_parents.name: Aminoglycosides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing either anthracene-9,10-quinone, 1,4-anthraquinone, or 1,2-anthraquinone.
alternative_parents.name: Anthraquinones

alternative_parents.description: Monosaccharides in which the sugar unit is a is a six-carbon containing moeity.
alternative_parents.name: Hexoses

alternative_parents.description: Glycoside in which a sugar group is bonded through one carbon to another group via a O-glycosidic bond.
alternative_parents.name: O-glycosyl compounds

alternative_parents.description: Polycyclic aromatic compounds containing a tetralin moiety, which consists of a benzene fused to a cyclohexane.
alternative_parents.name: Tetralins

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a methoxybenzene or a derivative thereof.
alternative_parents.name: Anisoles

alternative_parents.description: Organic aromatic compounds that contain a ketone group substituted at one C-atom with an aryl group. They have the generic structure RC(=O)R', where R = aryl group and R'=organyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Aryl ketones

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the alkyl aryl ether functional group with the generic formula R-O-R' , where R is an alkyl group and R' is an aryl group.
alternative_parents.name: Alkyl aryl ethers

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an oxane (tetrahydropyran) ring, which is a six-member saturated aliphatic heterocycle with one oxygen atom and five carbon atoms.
alternative_parents.name: Oxanes

alternative_parents.description: Compounds in which a hydroxy group, -OH, is attached to a saturated carbon atom R3COH (R not H ).
alternative_parents.name: Tertiary alcohols

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a hydroxyl group, which is indirectly attached to a carbonyl via an intervening vinyl (>C=C<) moiety.
alternative_parents.name: Vinylogous acids

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a carboxylic acid, and an amine group attached to the alpha carbon atom, relative to the C=O group.
alternative_parents.name: Alpha-hydroxy ketones

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a secondary alcohol functional group, with the general structure HOC(R)(R') (R,R'=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Secondary alcohols

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an alkyl chain with an amine group bound to the C1 atom and an alcohol group bound to the C2 atom.
alternative_parents.name: 1,2-aminoalcohols

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one oxygen atom linked to a ring carbon.
alternative_parents.name: Oxacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds having the structure R2C(OR')2 ( R' not Hydrogen) and thus diethers of geminal diols. Originally, the term was confined to derivatives of aldehydes (one R = H), but it now applies equally to derivatives of ketones (neither R = H ). Mixed acetals have different R' groups.
alternative_parents.name: Acetals

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing more than one hydroxyl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Polyols

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds comprising the primary alcohol functional group, with the general structure RCOH (R=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Primary alcohols

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an primary aliphatic amine group.
alternative_parents.name: Monoalkylamines

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

class.description: Polyketides containing a tetracenequinone ring structure with a sugar attached by glycosidic linkage.
class.name: Anthracyclines

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as anthracyclines. These are polyketides containing a tetracenequinone ring structure with a sugar attached by glycosidic linkage.

direct_parent.description: Polyketides containing a tetracenequinone ring structure with a sugar attached by glycosidic linkage.
direct_parent.name: Anthracyclines

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

superclass.description: Organic compounds that are synthesized either from the amino acid phenylalanine (phenylpropanoids) or the decarboxylative condensation of malonyl-CoA (polyketides). Phenylpropanoids are aromatic compounds based on the phenylpropane skeleton. Polyketides usually consist of alternating carbonyl and methylene groups (beta-polyketones), biogenetically derived from repeated condensation of acetyl coenzyme A (via malonyl coenzyme A), and usually the compounds derived from them by further condensations.
superclass.name: Phenylpropanoids and polyketides
